revised_title: The Nature of the Substance in Serum that Influences Phagocytosis
tldr: The author investigates the relationship between serum dilution and phagocytosis, discovering that the number of microbes taken up by leucocytes is directly proportional to the concentration of bacterial emulsion. They also find that the opsonic power of both normal and immune serum decreases rapidly upon heating, suggesting the involvement of a thermostable substance and a thermolabile factor in the sensitizing action of serum.
